Description:
In this episode, we welcome Chef Anisha Latchman to the AI kitchen to cook up something special: GraphRAG. Anisha, a college senior and security intern, walks us through how GraphRAG‚Äîan open-source project from Microsoft‚Äîis transforming how we search and analyze security data using graphs and embeddings. From parsing emails to uncovering hidden relationships and themes, this episode is a delicious blend of technical insight and practical demo. Whether you're new to Retrieval-Augmented Generation or curious about graph-based search, this one's for you.

Chapters: 00:00 - Welcome to the Cozy AI Kitchen 00:20 - Meet Chef Anisha Latchman 00:33 - What is GraphRAG and Why It Matters 01:08 - GraphRAG Setup: Inputs and Configuration 01:36 - Emails as Input Data 02:02 - Running the GraphRAG API 02:46 - Indexing and Output Files Explained 03:00 - Understanding Nodes and Relationships 03:33 - Weighted Graphs and Their Importance 04:01 - Querying the GraphRAG Output 04:13 - Comparing Baseline RAG vs GraphRAG 05:00 - Community Search and Subgraphs 05:17 - Prompt Folder and Transparency 05:38 - Entity Extraction Prompt Deep Dive 06:03 - Prompt Engineering vs Context Engineering 06:40 - Chunking Strategies in RAG 07:30 - Final Query Results: GraphRAG vs Baseline 08:50 - Advice for Aspiring AI Builders 09:41 - Wrap-Up and Final Thoughts

What You'll Learn:

How GraphRAG enhances traditional RAG with graph-based context Why embeddings and nodes matter in security data analysis The difference between semantic search and graph traversal How to set up and run GraphRAG using open-source tools Insights into prompt engineering and chunking strategies
